posts.title: leetcode 2
posts.text: 2. Add Two Numbershttps://leetcode.com/problems/add-two-numbers/You are given two linked lists representing two non-negative numbers. The digits are stored in reverse order and each of their nodes contain a single digit. Add the two numbers and return it as a linked list.Input: (2 -> 4 -> 3) + (5 -> 6 -> 4)Output: 7 -> 0 -> 8 Solution Note

posts.title: leetcode 1
posts.excerpt: 1. Two sumhttps://leetcode.com/problems/two-sum/Given an array of integers, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to a specific target.You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution. Example:Given nums = [2, 7, 11, 15], target = 9,Because nums[0] + nums[1] = 2 + 7 = 9,return [0, 1].
posts.text: 1. Two sumhttps://leetcode.com/problems/two-sum/Given an array of integers, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to a specific target.You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution. Example:Given nums = [2, 7, 11, 15], target = 9,Because nums[0] + nums[1] = 2 + 7 = 9,return [0, 1]. Solution12345678910111213public class Solution { public int[] twoSum(int[] nums, int target) { Map<Integer, Integer> map = new HashMap<Integer, Integer>(); for(int i =0; i< nums.length; i++){ if(map.containsKey(target-nums[i])){ return new int[]{map.get(target-nums[i]), i}; }else{ map.put(nums[i],i); } } return null; }} NoteMap
